author: pwnh4
content: Hey, I am trying to understand how the consensus state root that will be available on the execution layer will be computed / verifiable (ie what information it will contain and how we can use it to verify some part of the state), but can't find a detailed spec/doc on that, I might be missing something ðŸ˜„ Any good reads on the topic?

author: m.kalinin
content: It will be in one of EL block fields, passed by CL; the EIP suggests `ommers` as one of potential places for it to be put it, https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4788. Once this change takes into effect one will be able to securely read any data from a beacon state (and historical beacon blocks using historical accumulators) provided with the merkle proof upon a beacon state root
